abstract: Thai authorities investigate United States ambassador for comments perceived as insulting to country's ailing king; diplomat, who cannot be charged with crime due to diplomatic immunity, questioned long prison sentences handed down for criticizing monarch; episode reflects decline of relations between America and ruling military junta who are fiercely protective of king.
lead_paragraph: The police said that the ambassador, Glyn T. Davies, had diplomatic immunity, but that they were obliged by law to investigate the complaint.

headline.main: Thai Police Investigate U.S. Ambassador on Suspicion of Insulting King
headline.print_headline: U.S. Envoy Is Accused of Insulting Thai King

snippet: The police said that the ambassador, Glyn T. Davies, had diplomatic immunity, but that they were obliged by law to investigate the complaint.
